comments.commentBody:
A psychological explanation is posed in this essay. The answer may come under the rubric of psychological -- but a far more economical explanation is ambition without knowledge and intelligence in the areas a president must know.

The GOP has a unique bunch of people who lack the very cognitive skills which are mandated for the White House.

With the exception of Romney, Paul, Huntsman and Gingrich who are all quite intelligent, the remainder are unqualified for the position they aspire to. [I plan to vote for Obama.]

Palin began a trend as a celebrity with good looks which carried her. Then Bachmann, Trump...

And, Herman Cain. Did Cain have a "brain freeze" when he didn't know that China had a nuclear bomb for about a half century? Or couln't answer the Libya question posed to him by the editorial staff today? Cain doesn't know anything about foreign affairs.

He has a manipulative type of charm which attracts some Republicans. Perry, a lazy governor wants to be president and knows nothing.

Lack of intellectual curiosity and not knowing history is more likely the reason. We may all suffer 'brain freeze.' But the clowns running for the GOP presidential nomination (with exceptions noted above) are simply not qualified -- period!

I've been making Sweet Potato Pear Puree for a number of years.  It's delicious and easy!  I just bake yams (or sweet potatoes), scoop out the insides, and mix them up in the food processor with an (approximately) equal amount of pureed pears.  It's great that way, but if you like it richer, you can throw in some cream or half and half.  It's wonderful just like that, but if you'd like to make it look prettier, you can put the mixture in an oven-proof dish and top with thin slices of pear and bake for a few minutes till it's caramelized on top.

How can bloodthirsty Americans think differently?  A genocidal mentality is indubitably at the very heart of American psyche.Your major part of economy is  depend on armed  manufacturing,if there no war how can your economy prosperous.I  think constantly engaged in war is national pride of America.I am 100 p.c. sure  in next election Republican candidate  will  be president  and he will start a war with Iran defeated Iran, America  will be reaches oil owner in the world.

Finally a hint of progress as the individual players begin to understand the Klinsmann game, total football played with the brain as much as their brawn or their speed. The ratings are always fun to consider though they are of little importance at this point since the tryout system which the coach has embarked upon will gradually sort out who can play versus the players who have yet to learn to play at this level. The MLS players, some of whom are fine athletes, are so far behind those who play overseas that they hurt their chances of making the starting eleven no matter how hard they try, since they do not understand the basics, through inexperience and quite likely shoddy coaching as they came up through the US soccer system.

The basics are emerging and quite possibly will pay dividends in the World Cup qualifying. The difference between the decent efforts under Bob Bradley and the game which Klinsmann is attempting to instill is immense.

The team is emerging at last. The backbone remains Howard, Bocanegra, Bradley, Donovan, Altidore finally exerting his formidable presence with his partner Buddle making his presence felt in combination, and Dempsey, an excellent competitor. Among the new boys, there is, for the first time decent potential, though the sorting out process is not yet complete.

The adage that with seven top drawer players a team is formidable and will win 60% of its games, becomes a good to great team with sixteen excellent determined football players. We may be getting close. Qualifying should offer both quite a challenge and a lot of fun.
Congratulations. The Bush/Blair/Cameron tag team triumphs. The Eurozone joins the US in achieving the status of failed states.

In addition to the Hahvahd tours, Harvard's student-run Crimson Key Society tours, also free to the public, are given by a passionate group of undergraduates in red sweatshirts daily at 10 am, 12 pm, and 2 pm. Please see http://www.crimsonkeysociety.org/toursservices/historical-tours for more information.

Just wanted to bring attention to an incredible tour guide organization of which I am a member and about which I am so enthusiastic - our tours also combine history with practical knowledge, humor, and fun!

Too many people side on MOB JUSTICE.

One wonders why those types read, if they read, the New York Times.

I know this is an upset, given his math nerdiness, but Chase is a fun guy to hang out with. If he were out in Seattle for Thanksgiving, MikeLew, you could invite him to Pike Place market for poisson distribution.

From John LeCarre's "The Constant Gardener":
"...the qualifications for being a civilized state amount to electoral suffrage, protection of life and property, justice, health and education for all...maintenance of a sound administrative infrastructure, roads, transports, drains, etc....and the equitable collection of taxes. If it fails to deliver on at least a quorum of the above--the contract between state and citizen begins to look pretty shaky. If it fails on all of the above, then it's a failed state..."

The people we're paying to protect our interests are only protecting their own. It's hard to see failure from the back seat of a limo. Fortunately, due to our generosity and largesse, they won't notice reality creeping up on them until just after they form those famous words: "Let them eat cake." The organic solid waste is indeed about to interact with the rotational aeration apparatus.

I've been following readers' commentary in the health care debate and find it surprising how few people rebuke the high costs for any mandatory monthly premiums.  With real wages going downward, part-time employment, inflation, higher cost-of-living expenses. I live frugally, paycheck to paycheck, there isn't any wriggle room in my budget. Assuming people can afford to pay Obamacare monthly premiums over $400 isn't realistic! I consider myself lucky to have part-time employment without health care, and I'm the only one employed in my household.
Those who subsist in malignant fantasy naturally perceive realists as pessimistic.

I read autobiography of  Rousseau.My impression is  he wrote  so much   lie so much  hyperbole  how can genuine reader believed this rascal?In 21Th century  can any rational man blindly believed in Theodicy?   From Buddha  to Marx all are given mankind  solution for    pain and misery but world remain as it is.They could not find out magical medicine   to cure the pain and misery of mankind. I think they completely ignorant of irrationality of mankind.Man is irrational animal and constantly lived on illusion.Man live from birth to  end of of life to avoid fear of death.Death only give meaning to our life. . overcome the fear of death  is main motto of our life.This motto  force us behave irrational way.We ready to murdered some one ,sacrificed  our life for save  mankind..Irrational behavior  work on emotion. and our emotion are always fickle run form here to there..So improvement the mankind or bring peace and prosperity in the world is futile effort..All utopias throw way by mankind in dustbin. Change yourself is also  most laughable illusion.I learn one lesson from reading western and eastern philosophy.try your best to create pure joy and self-satisfaction in your life doing some creative work.Pure joy and self-satisfaction  is only most valuable achievement  man can acquire.

I watched the Costas interview and I thought he missed the crucial questions. This whole thing has been represented by the oops media as a football scandal, and a massive cover-up, and a failure of heroic figures.institutions to discharge their responsibilities blah bah. That being so, why didn't Costas ask if Sandusky's alleged activities had already come to the attention of the police, and already been examined by the local district attorney.
Costas didn't notice that? Really?
If he had asked the right questions he and the audience would have found out the police were in on the case long before Paterno, accused of not reporting to the police, was, and that the DA would not act on the 1998 allegation, long before Penn State was alleged ot be covering something up. .
So why were Penn State, and Paterno, represented as guilty parties? Who from?
It is a scandal and a tragedy to be sure, and part of the tragedy is that the incompetent media has done as much harm to innocents in a week. as Sandusky did in a lifetime.
Hooray.
If they can nail anyone nearby who has a reputation they can sell more papers, which is OK if they are sufficiently sanctimonious.

cglobek
Too bad Costas didn't interview Strauss-Kahn.

To those who complain that the legal system should do its job and that cancelling games (season games, bowl games) amounts to pre-judging or mob justice, you are mixing apples and oranges. The criminal and civil courts can and will resolve the criminal and civil tort claims that result from the allegations. Meanwhile, PSU has taken administrative actions based on what is currently known. Administrative action does not require a jury of peers, guilt beyond shadow of doubt, or criminal due process. Cancelling footbal games is an administrative act in response to the situation and its impact on the university. Sandusky will have his day in court. Meanwhile, PSU is being and should be judged in the court of public opinion.

The author misses a bifurcation in Steve Jobs' personality. Yes, he was person who put usability and design first. That appeals to prosumers, particularly. But, Steve Jobs was also an UBER businessman. He chose to concentrate on consumers because a small company (which Apple was in the 1990s) can reap higher margins as a boutique vendor. The decision was to make the best computers and sell them at a premium price. However, Jobs' goal expanded around the time 'computer' was dropped from Apple's name. In the last few years, after working with AT&T to bring out and perfect the iPhone, and, being a major stockholder at Disney, Jobs was certainly interested in the business market. The article makes it sound like Jobs was hostile to business. He was not.

The people calling Macs "toys," and demanding a return to desktop computers/work stations will just have to adjust to change. The iOS devices, starting with the original iPod, have been signals of where technology is headed. Miniaturization. Convergence of different uses in one device. The app revolution. The cloud. Laptops will be the typical computer for business and consumer use in the foreseeable future. Tablets will be preferred ancillary devices when a smart phone is not sufficient.

I also gather that some commenters do not realize that Apple isn't failing because of its former lack of presence in enterprise. It is the most successful technology company in the world. Interest in enterprise is about expanding and maintaining leadership, not because Apple is desperate. It isn't.

STRANGE piece. i don't think the writer truly understands what the stanley cup means. nice to play for your country and winning gold will always be a thrill, but teammates are temporary, not guys who have slogged with you for, in many cases, year after year after year.

So who else is there, beside the top four? Berdych, Ferrer, Tsonga, and Fish will be in London, but it's had to see any of them making it all the way through. Even Andy Murray would have to rise to new heights to win it all, but let's not say it's beyond his reach. (Who would have picked Davydenko in 2009?)

The two missing parties, missing due to illness or injury, in my opinion are del Potro and Soderling. It's more true of del Potro, but I think each of them has a big enough game (indoor hard court) to pull off a win in London if everything were to line up just right.

It's a great time for men's tennis. Great players, great rivalries, and it should be a great week in London. Djokovic looks vulnerable, Nadal's a bit of a question mark. I like Roger if Rafa's not 100%.

Gingrich is a modern day Arafat of modern politics.  On mainstream outlets, he will sound reasonable. On conservative ones, he will invent facts and drive them with incredible certainty.  Calling for jailing Sen Dodd and Rep Frank is incendiary demagoguery.  He is more dangerous than Bachmann.

This was the first game that I saw Buddle show some skill. It is deceptive, because on the surface he appears to be very slow, and takes a lot of time to react and get the ball off of his feet. But in watching the game again, he made several quick, clever passes (not to mention his goal), and he held up the ball well, Jozy Altidore style.

I'm trying to understand what Klinsmann sees in Beckerman. A holding midfielder's role is to disrupt the other team's attack, correct? I've seen him do that, but when he has the ball it's messy and worrisome. Maybe he's in good shape for 90 minutes, but speed is also not one of his strengths.

I was a big Obama supporter, but I am really disappointed with him. I may write in Russ Feingold or Bernie Sanders, because it seems that Obama's many compromises have further empowered the Rabid Right.
Obama has not delivered for the students or the country...he is truly inept.  Epic Fail!  No new ideas...
If the young people won't work with us, then the grownups will have to take charge in the efforts to reelect or decent, imperfect, but sensible President.

What seems to be not said throughout the article and most of the comments is that the political system of this country and indeed most of the world is broken. It does not work. It is not producing real choice or furthering the goals of a true democracy. My guess is that most people have had enough of the game.

We have so many choices for products throughout the world but for leaders we have nothing. Tired political parties that are entirely clueless. The Congress in the US has an all time low satisfaction rating in the polls but it doesn't matter. Throw them out and more of the same comes back in, bought and paid for with endless corporate money.

Where is the will of the people to fashion something else? How can we abide the monstrosity of what has been created? Is endless war, corporate dominance, and a populace entirely disconnected from the reins of their governments throughout the world the future for all of us?
Obama and Biden have been politicking and campaigning for a solid 3 years.  We only have to put up with one more and they're gone. For good.
